intro: Isoetes boryana subsp. asturicensis, commonly known as the Asturian water fern, is a rare aquatic plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the genus Isoetes, which includes species characterized by their spore-producing sporangia and specialized root structures. This subspecies is typically found in freshwater habitats such as ponds and wetlands, where it thrives in nutrient-poor environments. Its morphology includes a rosette of narrow, sword-shaped leaves that float on the water's surface. The plant plays an important ecological role in maintaining aquatic biodiversity and water quality.
